descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Talend is looking for an experienced, professional, innovative and driven Account Executive to maximize Talend’s revenue potential by continually developing the company’s market exposure and presence in the Small Business segment in EMEA North.
 
To sustain our impressive growth, we are looking for drivers, individuals who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge. We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent.
Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily. We invite you to join in to stand out.
 
The ideal candidates will have a demonstrable track record of both renewals of existing customers and new business pipeline generation and end-to-end sales cycle management in the Enterprise Software industry.

A fantastic opportunity to be part of the faster growing GTM segment in Talend, with huge potential to over achieve and succeed.

lists.content:
• Responsible for generating incremental business in Talend’s Small Business segment (primary quota carrying role), developing and closing business over the phone as well as on-site as well as managing renewals for existing accounts for some of our small business customers.
  • Actively prospects within account set to discover and cultivate sales opportunities and interfaces with both internal and external stakeholders to manage end-to-end sales cycles.  
  • Establishes professional and consultative relationships with clients, at any level within their organisation, by developing a core understanding of the unique business drivers within their industry.
  • Participates in Market sales strategy.  Defines and executes Territory and Prospecting plans.
  • Manages sales pipeline, forecasts accurately on a monthly and quarterly basis, and uses sales tools with operational excellence (including CRM system and various prospecting tools).
  • Meets or exceeds individual targets and sales activity objectives.

• At least 5 years sales experience in the Enterprise IT industry (solution and subscription sales), preferably in the software industry, with proven sales track record.
  • Track record in new Business Development and Client Sales roles.
  • Able to successfully navigate complex contract negotiations with senior business leaders.
  • Able to demonstrate solid communication and presentation skills.
  • Able to take ownership for business planning in allocated territory and demonstrate a strategic approach to success.
  • Proven influencing and negotiating skills at executive level gained from structured industry recognised sales training (MEDDIC, Challenger, 3 Whys)
  • Must be able to work autonomously, self-starter and team player
  • Motivational and positive attitude

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Senior Events Manager – EMEA Central
 
You’ll be responsible for ensuring our field marketing events across EMEA Central are handled expertly, creating and executing events that deliver real business outcomes. You’ll work with Sales, SE’s, Product Marketing, Customer Success and channel partners to build a customer-first event strategy that enhances Talend’s brand reputation and builds pipeline for Sales.
 
What you'll be working on
- Define for Talend events in EMEA Central (from owned events like Talend Executive Roundtables and technical webinars, to sponsored trade shows and conferences).
- Drive the regional roll out conferences
- Facilitate all strategic, logistical and operational planning and management of events
- Lead pre- and post-event meetings to communicate and align on planning elements with relevant stakeholders (Sales & Field Marketing) and debrief to incorporate learnings for future best practices 
- Scale the success of events in our EMEA Central (DACH+CEE)
- Maintain calendar of planned events ensuring alignment with Sales and customer success and the global marketing teams.
- Project manage event promotion via multi-channel comms, including email marketing and social
- Track KPI across all programs and tactics including account engagement, opportunities created, pipeline and revenue
- Build trusted relationships across the EMEA Central team and the Talend Marketing team.
 
Experience
- Fluent in German Language is required for this role. 
- Excellent organizational skills with a strong attention to detail you naturally build processes and checklists and enjoy driving your projects 	    forward
- A great collaborator. You find it easy to get buy in to your projects and unblock challenges as they arise
- Proven ability to excel in a fast-paced environment is extremely important, particularly an entrepreneurial attitude and the ability to thrive in an environment of change and ambiguity 
- Communication skills that challenge the best communicators. You understand how to work with people, and you easily can balance diplomacy and assertion
- Advanced project management skills, and you can take any project through to completion on time and within budget
- Have worked closely with Sales to generate leads and opportunities.

additionalPlain:
TALEND PAY TRANSPARENCY:

At Talend, fair and equitable compensation is a fundamental part of our company’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging strategy. Talend takes a market-based approach to pay, and therefore pay ranges may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of three zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates working in the United States, the hourly rate
range for this role will be:

Zone 1- Atlanta, Dallas/FW, Austin, Minnesota, Chicago Metro, Salt Lake City, Denver, Sacramento, San Diego, DC Metro, Boston, Rest of the USA: $20 - $23 USD per hour
Zone 2- NYC Metro, Los Angeles, Orange County, Seattle, Philadelphia: $21 - $24 USD per hour
Zone 3- San Francisco Bay Area (Alameda, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Contra Costa, Marin, SF, Santa Cruz): $23 - $25 USD per hour

Hourly rates may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, education, pay parity and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific hourly rate range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

At this time, we are not able to hire in the following locations: Hawaii and Alaska

Zone 2- NYC Metro, Los Angeles, Orange County, Seattle, Philadelphia: $21 - $24 USD per hour
Zone 3- San Francisco Bay Area (Alameda, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Contra Costa, Marin, SF, Santa Cruz): $23 - $25 USD per hour

Hourly rates may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, education, pay parity and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific hourly rate range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Talend is looking for anFP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) Intern to join our growing FP&A team. The right individual will assist our FP&A team in developing accurate forecasts, reporting on business metrics, and driving operational and strategic decisions through modeling and analysis.

This is a fully remote, part-time internship for three months. All early in career candidates, including current students, recent graduates, candidates making a career change, and candidates returning to the workplace, that are located in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.

We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.


Talend is looking for anFP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) Intern to join our growing FP&A team. The right individual will assist our FP&A team in developing accurate forecasts, reporting on business metrics, and driving operational and strategic decisions through modeling and analysis.

This is a fully remote, part-time internship for three months. All early in career candidates, including current students, recent graduates, candidates making a career change, and candidates returning to the workplace, that are located in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.

lists.content:
• Partner with functional leaders to re-forecast monthly expense and top line bookings.
  • Perform strategic analysis and ad-hoc reports to help senior management make better business decisions.
  • Prepare monthly financial and operational reporting packages for the board of directors, executive team, and senior business leaders.
  • Interact with accounting teams during month-end close process to ensure accurate reporting.
  • Identify and support special projects to continuously improve, automate, and scale forecasting and reporting tools, processes, and methodologies.
  • Prepare various analyses to support the Revenue organization. At the end of your internship, you will present a monthly financial summary to senior leadership.

• Available to work part-time (20 hours per week) for 12 weeks (3 months)
  • Team-player, self-starter, and eager to learn; you are proactive and able to juggle multiple projects.
  • Finance-related background experience or education preferred
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel (using basic formulas and able to work with data)
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills; you also have great interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; capable of communicating complex financial information in an easy-to-understand format.
  • Experience in investment banking, audit, corporate finance, or consulting a plus
  • At least 18 years of age or older.

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

To support our growth, we are looking for a cloud developer to integrate the team in charge of developing new features for Dataops platform where we develop all services needed to store customers artifacts (custom logic implemented with tools like Studio, Pipeline Designer or Data Preparation) and their related configuration. The project is also in charge of scheduling those artifacts with their appropriate configuration and collect the output logs and metrics and the Engines where the executions take place. Millions of workloads run over this platform every week.
The ideal candidate should be well-versed with the entire software development life-cycle.  Apart from possessing strong technical skills, she or he should be opened to technical and non technical options that will help improve the product.
You will work on Java with Springboot. It uses Docker, Kubernetes and modern CI / CD technology. The backends in use are PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka related backends (Kafka, Kstream, Kafka connect).
 
Key responsibilities
·      Integrate the team in charge of developing and deploying in production new features for Dataops Platform
·      Pay attention to monitoring/alerting on service team is responsible for, and be able to act on them during business hours
·      Design and develop the API for the new services under development with strong focus on performance
·      Collaborating with other team members in investigating and resolving technical and performance issues
·      Participate in architecture discussions
·      Implementing tactical and long-terms product scalability, maintainability improvements (could be architecture, code, script or documentation related)
·      Participate on Customer issues investigation


Skills and experience
·      At least around 2 years of practical experience in software development
·      Willingness to work in a large organization
·      Eager to learn and progress on every aspect of software engineering responsibility
·      In-depth knowledge and practical experience in Java and Spring
·      Ability to communicate smoothly, effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing.
·      Experience with services scalability, HA.
·      Experience with messaging tools like Kafka and Active MQ
·      Experience with DBs like Postgresql and MongoDB
·      Experience in API design


Other skills
·      Experience in working within a distributed & international agile team environment
·      Ability to work independently, strong interpersonal and communications skills
·      Strong ownership, proactively communication and identification of topics to work on
·      Experience with Kubernetes/Docker/Helm/Flux would be a plus
·      Experience with high demanding environments (SLA 99.5% and more) would be a plus
·      Experience on Apache Karaf would be a big plus

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in France**

Talend is looking for a Junior Site Reliability Engineer to join our growing team in France (Nantes office, in Hybrid mode). In this role, you’ll be responsible for the security, stability, and scalability of our Talend Cloud service. You’ll get to work hands-on with plenty of exciting technology and scale challenges as we grow to support millions of transactions across hundreds of servers in our Talend Cloud environment. We are seeking candidates with expertise on both development and system administration.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
·       Ensure high reliability and availability of the Talend Cloud platform
·       Develop new infrastructure features based on Cloud Technology in a Public Cloud environment
·       Define cloud-related optimizations and best practices to improve reliability, scalability and performance
·       Develop tooling, alerts, and response to both identify and address reliability risks
·       Work with fellow operations engineers and development teams on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of action
·       Participate in troubleshooting of cloud infrastructure, systems, network, and application stacks
·       Manage and deploy internal and external monitoring solutions
·       Perform on-call duty as part of a team maintaining the availability and performance of our cloud infrastructure as well as the various internal services and systems that these core services depend on.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: 
·       Basic practical experience in managing Cloud infrastructure OR one or more of Backend technologies (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka)
·       Bachelor's in computer science or a relevant field
·       One of following:
o   Basic practical experience in Cloud engineering and microservices domain (Docker, Kubernetes...).
o   OR basic knowledge and practical experience in one or more of the following technologies would be a good fit: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, ActiveMQ, scripting / automation (Bash, Python)
·       Nice to have: Basic experience with IaC / configuration mgmt. / systems automation tools at scale (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, etc.);
·       Initial proficiency in English communications, both oral and in writing
 
#LI-MM1 
#LI-remote

You will be responsible for prospecting, generating opportunities, closing new business and growing the existing customer base and will be recognised for your achievements and milestones. This is a fantastic opportunity for results-oriented individuals that enjoy working in a fast paced, competitive, yet collaborative work environment.

lists.content:
• Sell Talend’s comprehensive enterprise solutions via prospecting and relationship building
  • Understand and effectively communicate Talend’s Value Proposition
  • Ability to build trusted rapport with CXO level customer contacts
  • Insightful and strategic territory planning which focuses in building a strong pipeline of opportunities
  • Manage numerous opportunities concurrently and strategically through varied sales stages to closure, while mitigating risk and maximising upside
  • Manage forecasts, close deals, and track customer data using company standard CRM tools
  • Grow existing business relationships and acquire new business
  • Meet and exceed your assigned sales quota and performance objectives
  • Continue to build your personal skillset – you can never learn enough!

• 5+ years of successful experience selling enterprise software and services
  • Demonstrated market knowledge of competitive opportunities
  • Background of exceptional quota attainment
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Enterprise Account Executive – Florida and Southeast United States
 
Mission
We’re looking for an ambitious salesperson to help us evangelize Talend in the Midwest states of Arkansas, Missouri, Iowa and surrounding market.  We have an opening for an experienced sales executive to join our growing sales team.  We are looking for a track record of proven success with 8+ years of SaaS/Software sales focused on Constituent 360, Data Health, Data Fabric, Analytics, or related segments.
 
As an Enterprise Account Executive at Talend, you are a hunter and sales leader.  As a successful candidate, you are a creative, energetic, self-starter who understands the sales process.  You know how to sell innovation and outcome-based solutions and can drive deals forward to compress decision cycles. Always hunting for new opportunities, you must be able to rapidly land new accounts while cross-selling and upselling into Southeast region accounts.  Along with the chance to close exciting deals, we also offer accelerators above 100% quota attainment.  This is a career defining opportunity.
 
Outcomes
·         Present a thorough territory plan within first 90 days  
·         Close both net new accounts and expand existing accounts  
·         Efficiently identify and close fast initial lands while managing longer, complex expansion sale cycles  
·         Exceed activity, pipeline, and revenue targets  
·         Track all customer details including use case, purchase timeframes, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce  
·         Utilize a solution approach to selling and creating measurable outcomes for customers  
·         Evangelize Talend's enterprise cloud data platform
·         Ensure 100% satisfaction among all customers  
·         Prioritize opportunities and applying appropriate resources
 
Competencies
·         A minimum of 8+ years of closing sales experience in software.
·         You have previously worked in a growth-focused software company and you know how to navigate and be successful in a entrepreneurial environment
·         Prior success in big data, Cloud, or SaaS sales
·         Ability to simply articulate the benefits of modern cloud technologies
·         Proven successful track record of exceeding sales quotas
·         Must understand cloud data warehouses, Spark and big data

Why you should be interested in this role:
Low quota - aggressive accelerators
Opportunity for significant growth 
Perfect sized company - we're not a struggling start-up, not a behemoth

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**

We are looking for a Lead Frontend Developer to be part of our dynamic R&D Team in Portugal! As part of the Talend R&D Team, the Senior Frontend Developer (Front-End/JavaScript) applicant will be responsible for designing, implementing, integrating and optimizing our front-end Web-Application UI's. Within this position, the development will mainly be focused on user interface / client-side development based on JavaScript (ReactJS). The applicant would be able to work in an international team with up-to-date technologies and standards, incl. modern cloud-based deployment environment (AWS & Azure). There will be collaboration with the UX/UI teams. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
- Lead and mentor a team about 5 frontend developers (HR Management) 
- Technical conception and implementation of front-end product features 
- Common / shared ReactJS component development (Talend Design System: Coral) 
- Maintenance of existing product components 
- Providing suitable solutions for complex problems and provide potential options to the product owner on selected technical topics. 
- Apply and promote good development practices among the team and participate in front-end code reviews to provided qualified feedback to other team members.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: 
- Minimum of 7 years in JavaScript -based Web-Application development, with at least 2 years of practical experience using a web framework (React, Vue or Angular). 
- Experience in TypeScript and Sass. 
- Ability to lead and manage a feature team 
- Good architecture / roadmap vision 
- Experience to work in an agile development team / agile process. 
- Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing. 
- Ability to work within a distributed international team environment. 
- BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent. 

OPTIONAL, BUT DESIRABLE: 
Experience with cloud technologies (like AWS, Microsoft Azure or others) 
Experience with Jest / Testing-library / Storybook 
 
#LI-HM1 
#LI-remote

The Partner Marketing Manager is a role dedicated to providing marketing support to a defined set of named partners. You will work closely with sales to drive demand for our Talend Product and increase mindshare of Talend within our Partner Ecosystem. lists.content:
• Know The Partners: your value lies in knowing the partners, the customer and market. By working with your Channels sales and their partners, you will engage with partners to drive demand for our Talend product portfolio. You will be the primary marketing contact for our AMER business partners.
  • Enable the Partners: execute locally the global enablement program, take the responsibility on the marketing enablement for the AMER partners.
  • Market with Partners: Collaborate with Channel Sales and Field marketing teams to influence the Partners marketing investments and land the demand gen marketing tactics with business partners to drive business results, leveraging Co-Marketing funding.
  • Develop a quarterly plan that delivers YTY growth in Business Partner Opportunity Identification (channel pipeline) thru Co-Marketing and enablement programs.
  • Drive partner utilization of Co-Marketing programs by providing partners with the most current/applicable assets and marketing planning assistance.
  • Advocate and Integrate partners into Talend led marketing tactics and events.

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for a Principal Backend Developer (m/f). 
Talend Data Preparation, Talend Data Inventory and Talend Data Stewardship are the next-generation cloud data governance applications being developed at Talend. They bring intelligent and collaborative capabilities to datasets inventory and transformation for our customers and are the corner stone of Talend Data Fabric strategy. They leverage the new Talend runtime based on Apache Beam and Apache Spark and are built using Java & Scala, JavaScript and React. We uses Docker, Kubernetes and modern CI / CD technology. 
 
Responsibilities
 
·       Scoping and designing  products backend solutions
·       Evaluating new technologies, building proof of concepts and sharing findings
·       Define technical roadmap combining Data Governance products’ needs and the global Talend technical roadmap​
·       Owning the health of backend components (schedule upgrades, track tech debt…)
·       Collaborating with Architecture and Security teams to validate designs and integrate best practices ​
·       Guiding and mentoring other engineers
 
Skills and experience
 
·       7+ years of experience in Cloud application development
·       3+ years in designing and building highly-available and fault-tolerant enterprise and web-scale software
·       Strong knowledge of Object Oriented and/or functional programming
·       Experience working in an Agile SCRUM/Kanban environment
·       Knowledge of one of the Cloud providers environment (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform)
·       Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing
 
What we offer you
 
Join a friendly and passionate team to work with the latest cloud native approaches and technologies (Spark, Beam, K8S, Docker, Kafka, Terraform, AWS, Azure to name a few)
A challenging but rewarding environment with international scope
Flexibility of full remote working

At Talend, fair and equitable compensation is a fundamental part of our company’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging strategy. Talend takes a market-based approach to pay, and therefore pay ranges may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of three zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates working in the DC metro (DC, MD, and VA), Boston, NYC Metro (NY, NJ, CT), San Diego, LA/OC, Seattle, Philadelphia, the base salary range for this role will be $94,400 - $118,000 USD. For candidates in the rest of the country will be $88,000 - $110,000 USD.
 
Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, pay parity and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. In addition to your base salary, you will also be offered a 10% bonus and benefits. A comprehensive list of our company benefits and perks for USA-based employees can be found at the following link: https://usbenefits.talend.com/
 
At this time, we are not able to hire in the following locations: Hawaii and Alaska.

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Talend is looking for an analytical and experienced product manager that has experience in growing and optimizing products using product led growth techniques to add to our team in our Philadelphia office. As a PM at Talend, you will work alongside other skilled product managers, engineers, and product design and documentation leads. You’ll help identify the most impactful customer problems, figure out the best ways to solve them with our product and bring them to market. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Discover
- Get deep in the weeds with our product self-serve funnel – deeply understand the trial and conversion funnel and how to measure where customers get stuck
- Work across the entire team to source, vet and prioritize ideas and solutions to improve conversion rates and customer satisfaction
- Track and analyze key metrics for the product and the business and identify ways to improve them
- Gather feedback from customers and design and run experiments to help decide between different product paths

Organize
- Synthesize feedback from customers, the market and our team
- Direct engineering efforts specifically aimed at growing our self-service business
- Work with our amazing engineering team to plan, build and deploy product features
- Define and measure the impact of what we build

Communicate
- Help communicate across the company what we are doing and why
- Work with sales, marketing and engineering to optimize the product-led go to market through all aspects of the organization

lists.content:
• You’ve worked with software that was built or adapted to use product-led growth techniques –self-directed trials and onboarding, conversion and expansion over time.
  • You’ve done A/B testing and know how and when to apply it to discover the best solutions to reduce areas of friction in customer journeys
  • You are great at communicating in a range of different situations. Whether pitching the team on a new product direction to getting into the details of a feature with the engineering team, you take time to deeply explain fundamental (and technical) reasons behind your decisions
  • You understand technical concepts well enough to quickly scope things independently before getting an engineer's opinion and can hold your own in engineering conversations
  • You have a firm grasp of how to gather and interpret data to help influence how you approach product decision
  • You have at least 2+ years of product management experience

lists.text: WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON:
lists.content:
• Collaborate with the sales, technical, customer success, and marketing teams
  • Gather, enter, and analyze information; formulate the RFP responses
  • Conduct industry and fundamental analysis, create and deliver presentations, and work with other key business partners to develop perspectives and insights
  • Assist the RVP of Canada North with special projects as needed

• Outstanding record of academic achievement
  • Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
  • Initiative-taking and leadership skills in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
  • Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
  • Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization
  • Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively both verbally and in writing in English; French is not necessary but highly desirable

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**

We are looking for a QA engineer verse to the full scope of a testing strategy to join Management Platform team.
Talend Management Platform is a project where we develop micro services eg. Identity & Access Management, Logging, Security, Metrics collection services etc. which can be consumed by all Talend applications and products. This project expose a large set of API used by customers and all critical application of Talend Cloud. Management plateform is developed in Java 11, Springboot and Karaf. It uses Docker, Kubernetes and modern CI / CD technology (Jenkins, Flux, Helm). The backend in use are Postgresql, TimescaleDB, AMQ, Kafka, MongoDB.

Key Responsibilities:
- With the help of the team and the QA Lead, implement the test strategy and advocate testing best practices
- In collaboration with other QAs and developers, design and develop needed tools to validate the application efficiently
- Design and execute manual tests
- Develop and maintain automated tests on REST API
- Report and track defects
- Participate in the design of new features

Skills and experience:
- BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent
- 2+ years of practical experience in the role of QA Engineer or Software Developer
- Knowledge of Java
- In-depth knowledge and practical experience in testing techniques
- Good understanding of REST based services and how to validate them
- Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing
- Experience in working within a distributed agile team environment
- Passionate about software quality to provide the best experience to our customers
- Strong willing to learn new things including the latest technology
- Basic knowledge on Linux and command lines

Optional, but desirable:
- Experience in load and performance testing methodology and framework (Gatling)
- Container and Container Orchestration (Docker / Kubernetes)
- Cloud Environments / Deployments (AWS, Azure)

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Talend is hiring a Software Developer in Tests & Performances for its Change Data Capture team based in Suresnes, France.
 
Talend Change Data Capture makes it possible to replicate data from source applications to any destination quickly — without the heavy technical lift of extracting or replicating entire datasets. This ensures organizations always have access to the freshest, most recent data.
The low-touch, real-time data replication of Change Data Capture removes the most common barriers to trusted data. The data lake or data warehouse is guaranteed to always have the most current, most relevant data. As a results, users can have more confidence in their analytics and data-driven decisions.
 
Responsibilities:
·       Design and development of end-to-end automated tests and corresponding environments
·       Design optimization and improvement in our C/C++ code base to ensure performance stability or improvement
·       Ensure the end-to-end tests can be run in a continuous integration pipeline, from environments provisioning to test results report
·       Design and execution of manual tests
·       Report and track defects
 
Required Skills:
·       BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent
·       2 to 5 years of practical experience in the role of Software Engineer 
·       Good knowledge on test Tools and frameworks like Gatling, K6, …
·       Good knowledge on some relational data basis
·       In-depth knowledge and practical experience in code optimization and testing techniques
·       Good knowledge of C/C++
·       Good knowledge and understanding of REST based services, Messaging / Streaming
·       Experience in working within agile team international environment
·       Passionate about software quality to provide the best experience to our customers
·       Strong willing to learn new things including the latest technology
·       Professional English & Fluent French (spoken and written)
 
Optional, but desirable:
·       Experience in load and performance testing methodology and framework (Gatling)
·       Container and Container Orchestration (Kubernetes, Container)
·       Cloud Environments / Deployments (AWS, Azure)
·       Good understanding of big data technologies (EMR, CDH, Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, Kinesis, Kafka)
·       Databases: Snowflake, SQLServer, Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Kafka, Kinesis …

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**
 
As part of its growth, Talend is looking for a Senior Automation QA Engineer for its Data Governance Platform team. 
This team provides all necessary back-end services to support Talend's products requirements. All these services must comply with the expected 99.9% SLA requirement.
 
We are looking for an experienced Senior Automation QA Engineer comfortable with testing back-end services on Cloud-based distributed systems environments. The ideal candidate should be well-versed with the entire software development lifecycle
from development to production monitoring. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 
·       Work closely with PO (Product Owner), QA lead & development team to design relevant API and performance test cases
·       Implement fully automated integration test following a BDD (Behavior Driven Development) methodology 
·       Design and develop test automation framework enhancements 
·       Ensure the API tests can be run in a continuous integration pipeline, from environment provisioning to the test results report 
·       Design and execution of API tests 
·       Report and track defects 
 
Skills and experience: 
·       BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent 
·       3+ years working in senior level test automation roles
·     4+ years testing experience with web-based application, preferably in an Agile environment
·       Good knowledge of Java to develop and implement automated tests/frameworks
·       In-depth knowledge and practical experience in testing techniques 
·       Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing
·       Passionate about software quality to provide the best experience to our customers 
·     Proficient in using tools like Git, Jenkins and Jira.
·       Strong will to learn new things including the latest technology 
 
Optional, but desirable: 
·       Experience with monitoring tools (Kibana, Grafana…) 
·       Experience in load and performance testing methodology and framework (Eg: Gatling) 
·       Test Tools and Frameworks like Postman, JBehave, Cucumber
·       Container and Container Orchestration (Docker / Kubernetes) 
·       Cloud Environments / Deployments (AWS, Azure) 
 
What we offer you: 
·        ��Join a passionate team and work with the latest cloud native approaches and technologies.
·         A challenging but rewarding environment with international scope 

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Data Processing Platform team to evolve our platform to integrate the new CDC Talend offer in the Cloud Data Processing Platform.
The Data Processing Platform team sits at the center of data processing in Talend. We work with product teams to design and build the next-gen data processing engines and APIs. Our tech stack is JVM-based (mainly Java & Scala), in addition to modern REST APIs. We also leverage K8s to deliver and run our services at scale in production.
 
Responsibilities:
·      Participate in the design and implementation of scalable solutions for the Data Processing Platform
·       Collaborate with other Talend Cloud teams to provide data processing runtimes and APIs
·       Contribute to the testing and benchmarking frameworks
·       Contribute to the integration and deployment phases
·      Mentor/guide junior team members.
 
Skills and experience:
·      At least 5 years of practical experience in software development 
·      Good knowledge of software development best practices (micro-services architecture, design patterns, testable code)
·      Strong knowledge in Java, knowledge in Scala/Python
·      Familiarity with CDC (Change Data Capture) technologies
·      Good understanding and hands-on experience with Kubernetes and Docker
·      Familiarity with Agile development methodologies 
·      Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing. 
 
Nice to have:
·      Experience with a public cloud platform such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
·      Experience with Helm charts and Flux
·      Experience with Helm charts and Flux
·      Experience in working within a distributed & international agile team environment. 
 
What we offer:
·       Join a passionate team and work with the latest cloud native approaches and technologies (Quarkus, Java17, Beam, Akka, Play!2, K8S, Docker, Kafka, AWS (Amazon Web Services), Azure to name a few) 
·       A challenging but rewarding environment with international scope. 
·       Twice a year one-week hackathon
.     Great perks (wellness program, digital events....)

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

Talend is looking for a Senior Data Integrity Specialist (Sales Operations & Administration) in our Bangalore, India office who is responsible for the overall governance of the availability, usability, integrity, and security of the data employed in the entire organization. The development and tracking of data integrity will be critical to enhance the understanding of the business and to improve decision-making to drive improvements for sales and revenue generation. 

As the Sales Operations functions, we are responsible for keeping the business running and ensure accurate reporting of our data at any point in time. Attention to detail are key to our day to day job. We ensure that the processes are executed on a timely basis according to company procedures, with exceptions identified and appropriate action taken. The company views us as an instrumental part in meeting the desired business objectives. We are a multi-cultural, global team working in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment. Therefore, we are searching for a fast learning, global thinking, data-driven, innovative and fun mind to join our global operations team.

WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.


Talend is looking for a Senior Data Integrity Specialist (Sales Operations & Administration) in our Bangalore, India office who is responsible for the overall governance of the availability, usability, integrity, and security of the data employed in the entire organization. The development and tracking of data integrity will be critical to enhance the understanding of the business and to improve decision-making to drive improvements for sales and revenue generation. 

As the Sales Operations functions, we are responsible for keeping the business running and ensure accurate reporting of our data at any point in time. Attention to detail are key to our day to day job. We ensure that the processes are executed on a timely basis according to company procedures, with exceptions identified and appropriate action taken. The company views us as an instrumental part in meeting the desired business objectives. We are a multi-cultural, global team working in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment. Therefore, we are searching for a fast learning, global thinking, data-driven, innovative and fun mind to join our global operations team.

lists.content:
• Support Global Sales and Marketing organization with accurate data needed for sales strategy, lead generation, and order processing
  • Handling large amounts of data to be cleansed, de-duped and analyzed to lessen or remove inaccuracies in the organizations Sales Territory and Revenue Alignment
  • Monitor data integrity, inquire with teams on errors in data, and develop new processes for gathering data more efficiently and error-free
  • Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the organization
  • Ensure that newly created accounts are accurate per our business standards 
  • Update SFDC based on contractual agreements
  • Ensuring the data in our CRM and ERP is accurate prior to and after order acceptance
  • Ensure database standards and participate in testing of ERP/CRM systems as requested

• Data driven individual with a strong business acumen and focus on analytical problem solving, data manipulation and management skills
  • Must Have excellent computer skills, including CRM software (salesforce.com) and business applications (Outlook, MS Word, MS Excel)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Strong team player with a positive attitude and a focus on learning with a continuous improvement mindset
  • Strong organization skills, time management skills, detail-orientation, and ability to multi-task
  • Talend product experience a plus
  • Analytics software skills a plus e.g. Tableau or similar

lists.text: Education, Certification, Training and Minimum Qualification
lists.content:
• BS/BA/BE or equivalent knowledge and experience. Masters degree is preferred, not mandatory.
  • At least 5+ years of sales operations experience
  • Fluent English mandatory – French, German or Japanese are a plus
  • Experience interacting with global stakeholders

text: Senior Data Integrity Specialist, Sales Operations & Administration

We are looking for a Senior Frontend Developer to be part of our dynamic R&D Team in France! As part of the Talend R&D Team, the Senior Frontend Developer (Front-End/JavaScript) applicant will be responsible for designing, implementing, integrating and optimizing our front end Web-Application UI's. lists.content:
• Technical conception and implementation of front-end product features
  • Common / shared ReactJS component development
  • Maintenance of existing product components
  • Providing suitable solutions for complex problems and provide potential options to the product owner on selected technical topics.
  • Apply and promote good development practices among the team and participate in front-end code reviews to provided qualified feedback to other team members

• Minimum of 4 years in JavaScript -based Web-Application development, with at least 1 year of practical experience using a web framework (React, Vue or Angular).
  • Experience in TypeScript and Sass.
  • Good knowledge of HTML and REST/JSON.
  • Experience to work in an agile development team / agile process.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work within a distributed international team environment.
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

• Experience with Linux/Windows
  • Experience with cloud technologies (like AWS, Microsoft Azure or others)
  • Experience with Jest / Testing-library will be a plus

It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

As a member of the Intelligent Service, you will be part of the team deploying state-of-the-art MLOps infrastructure solutions for the production of Talend Product ML based features. As a ML Ops you will take part to the design, implementation, run and maintenance of the platform to deploy and monitor into production ML models developed by Data Scientist as scalable ML Services to be used by Talend end-users.

Responsibilities:

·       Design implement and manage in production the cloud native engineering infrastructure for the deployment of Talend Cloud App data collection pipelines and to support the enterprise machine learning systems at scale
·       Take offline models built by data scientists and turn them into a real machine learning production API service
·       Develop and deploy scalable infrastructure and services for Talend Product teams to handle machine learning training and inference
·       Identify and evaluate new technologies to improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of our machine learning systems
·       Apply software engineering rigor and best practices including CI/CD, automation, etc. with an emphasis on data security
·       Facilitate the development and deployment of proof-of-concept machine learning systems
 
Skills:
·       Experience building end-to-end systems as a Platform Engineer, ML/Dev Ops Engineer, or Data Engineer (or equivalent)
·       Strong software engineering skills in complex, multi-language systems
·       Fluency in Clojure and ability to learn new languages quickly
·       Experience developing microservices with containers and Kubernetes in cloud computing environments (AWS preferred)
·       Experience building custom integrations between cloud-based systems using APIs
·       Experience with distributed event store and streaming platform (ex: Apache Kafka)
·       Comfort with Linux development environment
·       Comfort with Infra-as-Code methodology (ex : Terraform, Strimzi)
·       Strong understanding of software testing, performance benchmarking, and continuous integration (ex: Jenkins, Github actions)
Nice to Have: 
·       Familiarity with some MLOps platform (ex: Sagemaker)
·       Exposure to machine learning methodology in Production environment and best practices
·       Familiarity with one or more data-oriented workflow orchestration frameworks (ex: MLFlow, KubeFlow)
 
Education & Experience

2–5 years experience building production-quality software

We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.


We are looking for an engaged and enthusiastic Senior Data Engineer to join our brand new Telemetry Platform Team !
We make the pattern « You build it, you run it » a reality for the Products teams and make them more autonomous, allowing them to create better products and solve customer problems faster.

lists.text: Reasons why we enjoy our work :
lists.content:
• We care about our fellow engineers at Talend who are our internal users but also, equally important, we care about Talend’s customers.

  • This is not only about what we do, but mostly why and how. We discuss business needs, plan and work out solutions collectively, as a team. We also measure and value our impact on the company.

  • We design, setup  develop and operate  a reliable and robust central telemetry data service to develop internal data-driven analytics and smart customer facing applications - combining the innovative Data Lakehouse and Data mesh data platform concepts.​

  • Teamwork is key and we enjoy solving problems together in pairs or as a whole team in an Agile approach.

lists.text: How you will make an impact:
lists.content:
• Build the brand new Telemetry Platform : You’ll build a strong data science platform that will allow Talend teams (Data Engineering, Professional services, Customer success, Sales, Marketing, Product managers…) have a better understanding of the Talend Data Cloud Platform usage from its customers, and Data Scientists team to develop ML based services for the Talend Data Fabric.

  • Deliver best-in-class solutions: Work with top notch data technologies for Data ingestion, Data batch and streaming processing.Data governance, Data advanced analytics and ML solutions. Collaborate with Data Scientist/analysts to develop and deploy ML models and services and deliver relevant insights and dashboards

  • Be a team player: Support the data scientist and the business in delivering seamlessly solutions that will help to have a better understanding of our Cloud platform usage. Promote new technologies, methods and raise awareness around new technologies and innovations

lists.text: We’re looking for a teammate who is a:
lists.content:
• Creative solution builder and passionate about Data Engineering! That includes experience in defining and evangelizing optimizations and best practices to build performing and scalable Data ingestion, processing,analytics/ML platforms

  • Experienced in Data engineering (we use state of the art open source data technologies such as the Apache Data ecosystem in a cloud native environment) and software development (Java, Python) as well as with automating cloud-based technologies, deploying applications

  • Which also means working knowledge of Cloud deployments (AWS/Azure) and Container/Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes DevOps ecosystem).

  • Autonomous with strong interpersonal & communications skills, also familiar with Agile contexts.

text: Senior Machine Learning Engineer Remote Portugal

Zone 3- San Francisco Bay Area (Alameda, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Contra Costa, Marin, SF, Santa Cruz): $70 - $75 USD per hour

Hourly rates may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, pay parity and location. In addition to your compensation, you will also be offered benefits, including, but not limited to, medical, dental, and vision well-being benefits. Your recruiter can share more about the specific compensation range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Global Benefits (Contractor) to lead the design, implementation, and management of Talend's global benefits program. This hands-on role will be responsible for reviewing, designing, implementing, and communicating innovative benefit offerings that align with Talend's objectives, educating employees, and ensuring ongoing legal compliance.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Global Benefits (Contractor) to lead the design, implementation, and management of Talend's global benefits program. This hands-on role will be responsible for reviewing, designing, implementing, and communicating innovative benefit offerings that align with Talend's objectives, educating employees, and ensuring ongoing legal compliance.
 
This role is highly collaborative and cross-functional, requiring regular communication with customers and stakeholders across the organization. The role requires enthusiasm, excellent organization skills, and a unique talent for nurturing strong, lasting relationships.

This is a full-time, remote contract position for the duration of 2023.

lists.content:
• Overseeing global benefits programs, including program management, data analysis, change management, stakeholder engagement, communication, and measurement of program effectiveness.
  • Designing and implementing global programs that align with Talend’s benefits philosophy and managing the design, implementation, and administration of benefit plans and programs, including health, welfare, retirement (401k, pension, & statutory), time-off, and other offerings.
  • Ensuring operational excellence in the day-to-day management of global benefits programs, including vendor management, new hire enrollment, open enrollment, compliance requirements, 5500 filings and regular audits, budget management, and system requirements.
  • Managing annual renewals and open enrollment planning, identifying, and recommending changes/enhancements to benefits and/or cost-sharing.
  • Owning benefit communication strategies to ensure effective promotion, understanding, and utilization.
  • Providing guidance to the global People Operations team and vendors on benefits administration responsibilities, including employee inquiries, claims assistance, benefits survey completion, eligibility, billing, COBRA, leave of absences, disability, and workers’ compensation administration.
  • Identifying opportunities for process improvements and recommending solutions for implementation.
  • Staying informed of current global and emerging market trends and offerings to identify potential opportunities and gaps, conducting benefits benchmarking and gap analysis.
  • Making strategic recommendations to maintain the competitiveness and cost efficiency of our programs.
  • Collaborating with external vendors and brokers to ensure compliance with local laws and regulations and negotiating and managing benefits contracts.
  • Analyzing and evaluating the effectiveness of the current benefits program and making recommendations for improvements.

• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or HR-related discipline
  • 7+ years of experience in global benefits and pension management, including in-depth knowledge of health and welfare and retirement benefits strategy, design, and best practices.
  • Demonstrated ability to coach and counsel direct reports
  • Extensive knowledge of global benefits laws and regulations with excellent communication skills and the ability to interact and influence others.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects within prescribed deadlines, with analytical thinking to conduct research, analyze data, and solve complex problems.
  • Experience negotiating coverage, services, and costs with carriers, brokers, and program vendors, and demonstrated ability to bring programs from concept to successful implementation.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop working relationships/partnerships with People Business Partners, People Systems and Operations, Legal, and Finance, as well as experience with Workday, electronic file feed and vendors systems.
  • Demonstrated ability to handle confidential employee information with discretion and good judgment and strong vendor management/partnership skills, good business acumen and confidence.
  • Ability to work well both independently and collaboratively.

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Global Benefits (Contractor) to lead the design, implementation, and management of Talend's global benefits program. This hands-on role will be responsible for reviewing, designing, implementing, and communicating innovative benefit offerings that align with Talend's objectives, educating employees, and ensuring ongoing legal compliance.
 
This role is highly collaborative and cross-functional, requiring regular communication with customers and stakeholders across the organization. The role requires enthusiasm, excellent organization skills, and a unique talent for nurturing strong, lasting relationships.

This is a full-time, remote contract position for the duration of 2023.

WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.


We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Global Benefits (Contractor) to lead the design, implementation, and management of Talend's global benefits program. This hands-on role will be responsible for reviewing, designing, implementing, and communicating innovative benefit offerings that align with Talend's objectives, educating employees, and ensuring ongoing legal compliance.
 
This role is highly collaborative and cross-functional, requiring regular communication with customers and stakeholders across the organization. The role requires enthusiasm, excellent organization skills, and a unique talent for nurturing strong, lasting relationships.

This is a full-time, remote contract position for the duration of 2023.

lists.content:
• Overseeing global benefits programs, including program management, data analysis, change management, stakeholder engagement, communication, and measurement of program effectiveness.
  • Designing and implementing global programs that align with Talend’s benefits philosophy and managing the design, implementation, and administration of benefit plans and programs, including health, welfare, retirement (401k, pension, & statutory), time-off, and other offerings.
  • Ensuring operational excellence in the day-to-day management of global benefits programs, including vendor management, new hire enrollment, open enrollment, compliance requirements, 5500 filings and regular audits, budget management, and system requirements.
  • Managing annual renewals and open enrollment planning, identifying, and recommending changes/enhancements to benefits and/or cost-sharing.
  • Owning benefit communication strategies to ensure effective promotion, understanding, and utilization.
  • Providing guidance to the global People Operations team and vendors on benefits administration responsibilities, including employee inquiries, claims assistance, benefits survey completion, eligibility, billing, COBRA, leave of absences, disability, and workers’ compensation administration.
  • Identifying opportunities for process improvements and recommending solutions for implementation.
  • Staying informed of current global and emerging market trends and offerings to identify potential opportunities and gaps, conducting benefits benchmarking and gap analysis.
  • Making strategic recommendations to maintain the competitiveness and cost efficiency of our programs.
  • Collaborating with external vendors and brokers to ensure compliance with local laws and regulations and negotiating and managing benefits contracts.
  • Analyzing and evaluating the effectiveness of the current benefits program and making recommendations for improvements.

• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or HR-related discipline
  • 7+ years of experience in global benefits and pension management, including in-depth knowledge of health and welfare and retirement benefits strategy, design, and best practices.
  • Demonstrated ability to coach and counsel direct reports
  • Extensive knowledge of global benefits laws and regulations with excellent communication skills and the ability to interact and influence others.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects within prescribed deadlines, with analytical thinking to conduct research, analyze data, and solve complex problems.
  • Experience negotiating coverage, services, and costs with carriers, brokers, and program vendors, and demonstrated ability to bring programs from concept to successful implementation.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop working relationships/partnerships with People Business Partners, People Systems and Operations, Legal, and Finance, as well as experience with Workday, electronic file feed and vendors systems.
  • Demonstrated ability to handle confidential employee information with discretion and good judgment and strong vendor management/partnership skills, good business acumen and confidence.
  • Ability to work well both independently and collaboratively.

additionalPlain:
TALEND PAY TRANSPARENCY:

At Talend, fair and equitable compensation is a fundamental part of our company’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging strategy. Talend takes a market-based approach to pay, and therefore pay ranges may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of three zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates working in the United States, the base salary
range for this role will be:

Zone 1- Atlanta, Dallas/FW, Austin, Minnesota, Chicago Metro, Salt Lake City, Denver, Sacramento, San Diego, DC Metro, Boston, and rest of the USA: $62 - $68 USD per hour
Zone 2- NYC Metro, Los Angeles, Orange County, Seattle, Philadelphia: $66 - $72 USD per hour
Zone 3- San Francisco Bay Area (Alameda, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Contra Costa, Marin, SF, Santa Cruz): $70 - $75 USD per hour

Hourly rates may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, pay parity and location. In addition to your compensation, you will also be offered benefits, including, but not limited to, medical, dental, and vision well-being benefits. Your recruiter can share more about the specific compensation range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

At this time, we are not able to hire in the following locations: Hawaii and Alaska

We are looking for a Senior Principal Cloud Architect to be a member of Talend’s Architecture Department which is responsible for architecture, design and governance of our Talend Cloud offering.

lists.content:
• Be deeply aware of the development activities in the R&D department and work with the engineering teams to be sure their work is coordinated with the overall product architecture and vision;
  • Work closely with the Data and Analytics teams to ensure the best in class architecture and operational excellence of Talend’s Product Telemetry Platform (Product Data Lake);
  • Work with teams to discover aspects of the team’s implementation that could be generalized and used in other areas of the company;
  • Gain consensus on architectural aspects by providing written (including diagrams) and verbal presentations and working with the implementation teams to resolve concerns;
  • Coding proof of concept (POC) implementations and reporting on those results;
  • Facilitate communication across departments so that people are informed and working well together;
  • Be aware of new technologies and how that might be applied to Talend’s Cloud products

• Between 3 and 5 years of experience in Cloud Native development and architecture
  • Strong interpersonal and excellent communication and presentation skills in English
  • Proficiency in a development language (Java, Python,…)
  • Solid knowledge and interest in Big Data, Data Management, BI, API management, Database Administration
  • Proficiency in Kubernetes
  • Solid knowledge of Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience;

• Experience in working within a distributed & international agile team environment
  • Experience in technical mentorship

text: Senior Principal Cloud Architect - Remote Portugal
