This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**

We are looking for an Automation QA Engineer to join our team in Portugal. Working in a fast-paced environment collaborating with a team of very talented people, you will be responsible for the automation for the Talend Data Processing Platform, to improve the platform’s quality and stability. 
You will define acceptance criteria, design and develop corresponding automated system tests to ensure a high quality of our runtime in the Cloud and on premise. 
The tests are highly automated and would allow you to work mainly on software development (Java, RestAssured), continuous integration and automated deployment. 

Skills and experience:
 
·        In-depth knowledge and practical experience in testing techniques.
·        Good understanding of REST based services.
·        Good working knowledge of at least one Linux/Unix based platform as well as Windows.
·        Knowledge in scripting languages (i.e., groovy, bash).
·        Knowledge in Java language.
·        Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both oral and in written.
·        Experience in working within a distributed international agile team environment.
·        Passionate about software quality to provide the best experience to our customers.  
 
Optional, but desirable:
 
·        BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
·        Minimum of 4 years of experience as a QA engineer.
·        Experience work in/with Cloud Environments / Deployments (e.g., AWS, Azure).
·        Understanding of Container and Container Orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker / Kubernetes).
·        Good understanding of Java networking
 
Job Responsibilities
 
·        Design and development of automation framework components for our runtime.
·        Implement fully automated integration and system tests.
·        Ensure the tests can be run in a continuous integration pipeline end-to-end, from environments provisioning to the test results report.
·        Running manual tests.
·        Support teams in support cases resolution.
·        Analyze, report and track defects.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**

additionalPlain:
TALEND PAY TRANSPARENCY:
 
At Talend, fair and equitable compensation is a fundamental part of our company’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging strategy. Talend takes a market-based approach to pay, and therefore pay ranges may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of three zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates working in the United States, the base salary
range for this role will be:
 
Zone 1- Rest of the USA: $70,401 - $96,802 USD
Zone 2- DC Metro (DC, MD, VA), Boston, NYC Metro (NY, NJ, CT), San Diego, Los Angeles, Orange County, Seattle, Philadelphia: $75202-$103,402 USD
Zone 3- San Francisco Bay Area: $83,202-$114,402 USD
 
Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, pay parity and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. In addition to your base salary, you will also be offered a 12% bonus and benefits. A comprehensive list of our company benefits and perks for USA based employees can be found at the following link: https://usbenefits.talend.com/
 
Currently, we are not able to hire in the following locations: Hawaii and Alaska
 
#LI-JD1


AND NOW, A LITTLE ABOUT US:

Talend has received some pretty impressive accolades along the way:

- 7,250+ global customers rely on Talend for their data health
- Named a Leader for Data Integration Tools by Gartner (for the 7th year in a row)
- Named a Leader for Data Quality Solutions by Gartner (for the 5th year in a row)
- Named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Enterprise Data Fabric (for the 2nd time in a row)
- Top 100 best Leadership teams, compensation and benefits 2022 by Comparably.com
- Ranked in the DBTA “100 Companies that Matter Most in Data”
 
We are passionate about helping companies become more data driven; and, if we can be honest, we are all geeks at heart who pride ourselves on the vibrant company culture that we have built.
 


As a global employer, Talend believes our success depends on diversity, inclusion and mutual respect among our team members. We want to look like our customers, and we recruit, develop and retain the most hardworking people from a diverse candidate pool. We are committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of business need, merit, capability and equality of opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us via email to request an accommodation at accommodation@talend.com. We appreciate your interest in Talend.

By submitting your application, you confirm you have read and acknowledge Talend’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. We may use automated decision making of your responses during our evaluation of your job application, for instance, to determine if your residence or proficiency fits the requirements for the job opportunity. You can exercise your privacy rights, including your right to object to automated decision making (if applicable), by filling out this privacy form or contacting privacy@talend.com.

Notice to Recruiters and Staffing Agencies
Talend does not accept any unsolicited applications from third parties – for our current agency policy please check here

lists.content:
• Affinity for SAAS software solutions and knowledge of the IT Industry
  • Excitement about outbound calling to turn cold leads into warm opportunities.
  • Work with designated Enterprise Account Managers to identify and prioritize key accounts to develop.
  • Working with the Sales & Marketing teams to identify new opportunities as well as following up on lead produced from regular Marketing campaigns. 
  • Ability to carefully listen and be able to absorb information.
  • Ability to communicate at a senior level up to C level.
  • Passionate about technology and strong desire to learn.
  • You will need to be very resilient and tenacious.

• 2-5 years minimum experience in sales or client success in a software/tech company is a plus
  • Strong understanding of B2B software and ideally SAAS sales
  • Experience in engaging with both cold and warm leads.

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

The Senior Sales Development Representative’s primary goal is to identify new lead sources and convert qualified prospects in the form of meetings for Account Executives who aim to seal the deal. This process gives you the ability to focus on being the best at what you do – strategically generating pipeline and moving prospects from meeting to qualified opportunity. 
 
We view this role as an opportunity to position yourself on a career growth path, with opportunity to progress within Talend through to future opportunities, through Sales, Marketing, Support, Customer Success or Professional Services.

This process gives you the ability to focus on being the best at what you do – strategically generating pipeline and moving prospects from meeting to qualified opportunity.
 
We view this role as an opportunity to position yourself on a career growth path, with opportunity to progress within Talend through to future opportunities, through Sales, Marketing, Support, Customer Success or Professional Services.

lists.content:
• Affinity for SAAS software solutions and knowledge of the IT Industry
  • Excitement about outbound calling to turn cold leads into warm opportunities.
  • Work with designated Enterprise Account Managers to identify and prioritize key accounts to develop.
  • Working with the Sales & Marketing teams to identify new opportunities as well as following up on lead produced from regular Marketing campaigns. 
  • Ability to carefully listen and be able to absorb information.
  • Ability to communicate at a senior level up to C level.
  • Passionate about technology and strong desire to learn.
  • You will need to be very resilient and tenacious.

• 2-5 years minimum experience in sales or client success in a software/tech company is a plus
  • Strong understanding of B2B software and ideally SAAS sales
  • Experience in engaging with both cold and warm leads.

additionalPlain:
TALEND PAY TRANSPARENCY:
 
At Talend, fair and equitable compensation is a fundamental part of our company’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging strategy. Talend takes a market-based approach to pay, and therefore pay ranges may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of three zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates working in the United States, the base salary
range for this role will be:
 
Zone 1- Rest of the USA: $70,401 - $96,802 USD
Zone 2- DC Metro (DC, MD, VA), Boston, NYC Metro (NY, NJ, CT), San Diego, Los Angeles, Orange County, Seattle, Philadelphia: $75202-$103,402 USD
Zone 3- San Francisco Bay Area: $83,202-$114,402 USD
 
Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, pay parity and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. In addition to your base salary, you will also be offered a 12% bonus and benefits. A comprehensive list of our company benefits and perks for USA based employees can be found at the following link: https://usbenefits.talend.com/
 
Currently, we are not able to hire in the following locations: Hawaii and Alaska

• Lead and expand a team of outbound SMB business development representatives.
  • Ensure the team has the resources and training needed to achieve targets.
  • Execute complex, solution based consultative lead qualification within large networks with major prospects.
  • Execute and/or supervise end to end sales lead activities, including prospecting, lead follow up, opportunity and qualification.
  • Maximize workflow within the department.
  • Identify problems and proactively create comprehensive plans of action to present to senior management.
  • Measure and report against KPIs, as well as create ad hoc reports as needed or requested by senior management.
  • Assist in recruiting, hiring, and training to grow and maintain sales development team.
  • Work closely with B2B marketing ensuring MQL targets are being met.
  • Proactively manage the team’s funnel to ensure quantity and quality of leads are being met.
  • Conduct and execute quarterly business plans with a focus on delivering targets.
  • Ability to analyze data to make short term and long-term decisions.

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in Portugal**


Talend is looking for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to join our growing team in Portugal (Remote). In this role, you’ll be responsible for the security, stability, and scalability of our Talend Cloud service. You’ll get to work hands-on with plenty of exciting technology and scale challenges as we grow to support millions of transactions across hundreds of servers in our Talend Cloud environment. We are seeking candidates with expertise on both development and system administration.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
·       Ensure high reliability and availability of the Talend Cloud platform
·       Work in collaboration with Engineering organization, including Architecture, Platforms, Domains teams
·       Design and develop new infrastructure features based on Cloud Technology in a Public Cloud environment
·       Define and evangelize cloud-related optimizations and best practices to improve reliability, scalability and performance
·       Design and develop effective tooling, alerts, and response to both identify and address reliability risks
·       Actively participate in working with fellow operations engineers and development teams on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of action
·       Use professional concepts, company objectives and technical expertise to resolve complex issues at cloud infrastructure, systems, network, and application stacks in creative and effective ways
·       Act as a resource for fellow SREs and peers with less knowledge on Cloud / backend technologies, production service operations, reliability, scalability, performance and capacity, security, incident management and troubleshooting
·       Manage and deploy internal and external monitoring solutions
·       Perform on-call duty as part of a team maintaining the availability and performance of our cloud infrastructure as well as the various internal services and systems that these core services depend on.
·       Provide regular updates on projects/activities status

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: 
·       3 years or more of practical experience in managing Cloud infrastructure and one or more of Backend technologies (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka)
·       Bachelor's or Master’s in computer science or a relevant field
·       Self-motivated, autonomous profile, with little guidance from management;
·       Organizational skills, ability to multi-task with close attention to details
·       Analytical skills for solving complex problems, taking a new perspective on existing solutions
·       Experience in planning and leading a project within a broader project, or having an accountability on ongoing deliveries/activities
·       Confirmed experience with IaC / configuration mgmt. / systems automation tools at scale (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, etc.);
·       Confirmed practical experience in Cloud engineering / architecture (at least one from AWS or Azure) and microservices domain (Docker, Kubernetes...).
·       Practical experience with Agile methodologies
·       Strong Knowledge and practical experience in one or more of the following technologies would be a good fit: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, ActiveMQ, scripting / automation (Bash, Python)
·       Administration of production databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
·       Proficiency in English communications, both oral and in writing
 
#LI-MM1 
#LI-remote

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for an Senior Software Engineer Backend (m/f) to join the Data Governance Domain team to work on 3 products :
 
Talend Data Preparation, Talend Data Stewardship and Talend Data Inventory are the next-generation cloud data governance applications being developed at Talend. They bring intelligent and collaborative capabilities to datasets inventory and transformation for our customers and are the corner stone of Talend Data Fabric strategy.
 
They leverage the new Talend runtime based on Apache Beam and Apache Spark and are built using Java, JavaScript and React and packaged/deployed using Docker, Kubernetes and modern CI / CD technology. 
 
Reasons why you should join our team :
 
-        Teamwork is key and though we have a remote first policy we exchange regularly to collectively discuss business needs, plan and work out technical solutions
 
-        Dynamic and diverse work environment
You will join a multicultural community with teams spread across Europe, Far East and America where you will solve technically challenging problems and have opportunities to move across different teams, change role or specialize into a specific area / technologies.
 
-        Great work life balance
Physical and mental wellbeing is at the core of many of our policies ranging from our remote first policy and providing mental health support. Our benefits package also includes one extra week holidays for the whole company (Talend week) and three volunteer days you can use to help make a difference in your local community (associations, charities…)
 
-        Exciting roadmap
Our team is building and developing solutions which are in the heart of Talend strategy to help solve our users’ problems associated with the growth of their data. This is a fast growing sector with a lot of interesting challenges to come!
 
 
How you will make an impact : 
 
-        Build and develop applications in the Data Governance Domain;
-        Cross-team communication, collaboration with architecture and engineering teams to deliver activities in line with the overall product architecture and vision; 
-        Support the product owner in planning activities (scoping/solution design workshops, refinements , estimations…);
-        Knowledge sharing & mentoring of junior members;
-        Contribute to the team’s self-management and continuous improvement;
-        Foster a culture of innovation by actively participating to our team and company hackathons;
 
The next team member should have : 
 
-        5+ years’ experience in development
-        Strong knowledge in highly-available and fault-tolerant enterprise and web-scale software deployments 
-        Strong knowledge in Java and Spring Boot
-        Knowledge of the Cloud providers environments (Amazon Web Services / Microsoft Azure); 
-        Good knowledge of Jenkins / Kubernetes / Helm
-        Strong interpersonal and excellent communication and presentation skills in English.
-        Team player mindset and experience or appetency in working within a distributed & international agile team environment.

The ideal candidate should be well-versed with the entire software development lifecycle from development to production monitoring. We are looking for skilled engineer comfortable with Java, Scala, Docker & Kubernetes but also experienced in debugging distributed systems. Apart from possessing strong technical skills, the candidate should show a strong bias for action. He should be open-minded and comfortable with the motto: "You design it, you build it, you operate it".

lists.content:
• Develop prototypes quickly to drive platform innovation
  • Recommend technical strategy and direction in area(s) of expertise
  • Build services that support large, complex applications.
  • Conduct complex analysis and provide recommendations on the utilization of emerging and existing technologies
  • Build new high level designs as required

• Take initiative and share innovative design patterns and frameworks, balancing implications of these choices on application usability, performance and maintainability
  • Lead a group of software engineers responsible for delivering scalable and performant platform
  • Lead by example, care for your team and always be there for them
  • Coach, guide, inspire and motivate team members​

• Analyze and improve efficiency, stability and scalability of services
  • Build 360-Degree monitoring dashboards of your Microservices
  • Strong Java skills
  • Feel comfortable with our current tech stack: NoSQL, RDMS, Spring, Docker, Kubernetes, microservices, various cloud technologies
  • You like most of our methods: Agile, continuous integration, automation, Iterative delivery

WHO WE ARE:

In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

**Applicants must possess the legal authorization to work in France**


Talend is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our growing team in France remote (Nantes office, Suresnes office, hybrid or Remote). In this role, you’ll be responsible for the security, stability, and scalability of our Talend Cloud service. You’ll get to work hands-on with plenty of exciting technology and scale challenges as we grow to support millions of transactions across hundreds of servers in our Talend Cloud environment. We are seeking candidates with expertise on both development and system administration.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
·       Ensure high reliability and availability of the Talend Cloud platform
·       Develop new infrastructure features based on Cloud Technology in a Public Cloud environment
·       Define and evangelize cloud-related optimizations and best practices to improve reliability, scalability and performance
·       Develop effective tooling, alerts, and response to both identify and address reliability risks
·       Work with fellow operations engineers and development teams on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of action
·       Be responsible for troubleshooting cloud infrastructure, systems, network, and application stacks
·       Manage and deploy internal and external monitoring solutions
·       Perform on-call duty as part of a team maintaining the availability and performance of our cloud infrastructure as well as the various internal services and systems that these core services depend on.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: 
·       2 years or more of practical experience in managing Cloud infrastructure and one or more of Backend technologies (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka)
·       Bachelor's in computer science or a relevant field
·       Experience with IaC / configuration mgmt. / systems automation tools at scale (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, etc.);
·       Practical experience in Cloud engineering / architecture (at least one from AWS or Azure) and microservices domain (Docker, Kubernetes...).
·       Practical experience with Agile methodologies
·       Knowledge and practical experience in one or more of the following technologies would be a good fit: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, ActiveMQ, scripting / automation (Bash, Python)
·       Administration of production databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
·       Basic proficiency in English communications, both oral and in writing
 
#LI-MM1 
#LI-remote

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for a Software Backend Engineer to join the Data Processing Platform Team. The Data Processing Platform sits at the center of data processing in Talend, working with product teams to design and build the data processing engines and APIs. We build the infrastructure layers required to handle the customers execution workloads wherever they need to be running. 

The Talend ESB Runtime is the framework that support the deployment of endpoints bound to data integration jobs defined in Talend Studio, within the customers infrastructure. This widely spread product involves several Apache framework such as Apache CXF, Karaf, and Camel. We are looking for a back-end developer to join the team as we need to prepare for our next-gen engine based on Kubernetes, as well as we need to keep on supporting our existing customers with regular updates. 

Your role in our team will be to:      

- Design, implement, test, and deploy fault tolerant and scalable services, mainly coded in Java;     
- Document the design of all implemented solutions;     
- Analyze and improve efficiency, stability and scalability of services     
- Provide support to the customer facing teams on specific technical topics      
- Work and communicate in a cross-functional geographically dispersed team environment comprised of software engineers, product managers, software test engineers, and product support engineers.      

Who you are:     

- Graduated in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience;     
- Proven experience in professional Java programming with RESTful, Message-/Event-Driven technologies, Multi-threaded applications;      
- Experience with Karaf or others dependency injection frameworks is a plus     
- You like most of our methods: Agile, continuous integration, automation, Iterative delivery     
- Ability to communicate effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing;      

What we offer:     

- Join a passionate team and work with a wide range of technologies (Karaf, K8S, Docker, Kafka to name a few)     
-  A challenging but rewarding environment with international scope     
- We give our employees space to further their technical knowhow     
- Regular team events and company celebrations

Sujet de stage de Master 2/ de fin d’étude d’école d’ingénieur
Durée 6 mois
Détection automatique de PII dans un dataset tabulaire

Mots-clés
Personal Identifiable Information, Semantic Type, Machine Learning, Topic Modeling, Classification, Automatic column detection

La société Talend et son contexte
Les solutions d’intégration, de big data, et de gouvernance de Talend aident les entreprises à tirer le meilleur parti de leurs données. Avec l’explosion du nombre de données générées, cette gouvernance devient un enjeu clef pour chaque organisation. Pour tirer profit de leur données, ces organisations doivent respecter les différentes réglementations en vigueur de confidentialité et de propriété. La compréhension du contenu de ces données est donc un enjeu majeur.
 
Dans ce contexte, l’équipe du Lab de Talend recherche un/une stagiaire pour développer un modèle permettent la détection automatique de données personnelles (GDPR, PII, PHI, ...) sur des jeux de données tabulaires.
 
De plus en plus de sociétés utilisent les solutions de Talend pour leurs traitements de données, toujours plus nombreuses. Plus de 4000 entreprises du globe s’appuient sur les solutions et services de Talend. La société est implantée en Amérique du Nord, en Europe et en Asie, et s’appuie sur un réseau mondial de partenaires. Pour plus d’informations : www.talend.com sur le Web et @Talend sur Twitter. Talend dispose depuis 2016 d’un centre de R&D à Nantes.
 
Objectif du stage
La détection des informations des données sensibles dans les jeux de données, très étudiées sur les corpus de textes, reste un enjeu sur les données structurées où les modèles ont souvent plus de mal à utiliser le contexte des données tabulaires. L'objectif du stage sera d'explorer les différentes possibilités pour créer un modèle et l’entraîner à identifier automatiquement les colonnes contenant des données personnelles dans le cadre des applications Talend. Le stagiaire sera intégré dans l'équipe Lab au sein du département R&D.
 
Proposition de déroulé de stage
·       Étude bibliographique (définition du problème, état de l’art, lecture de papiers académiques, sélection des algorithmes et des librairies les plus adaptées, etc..)
·       Identification de jeux de données type.  Construction d’un modèle.  Élaboration de la stratégie d’apprentissage du modèle, du processus de validation, de la construction des caractéristiques conditionnellement aux types de données.
·       Application sur les jeux de données sélectionnés, évaluation des performances du modèle et comparaison à l’existant ([2])
·       Rédaction de compte rendus
En fonction de l’avancée et de la pertinence des travaux, les résultats pourront donner lieu à des présentations et/ou une éventuelle publication scientifique.

Profil du candidat
Vous avez suivi une formation d’ingénieur spécialisé en mathématiques / statistiques et/ou apprentissage automatique ou toute formation équivalente.
Vous maîtrisez les outils de base de programmation (git, IDE …), vous avez la connaissance d’un langage de programmation orienté sciences des données (R, Python, ...), vous  avez la maîtrise des notebooks et vous avez idéalement réalisé des projets de data sciences ou participez à des challenges (Kaggle, Challenge Data Ens, KDD, ...).
L’innovation la qualité du travail fournit et le besoin de compréhension sont importantes pour vous.
Votre rigueur et votre sens de l’organisation vous permettent de respecter les délais impartis. Vous êtes autonome mais savez également travailler en équipe.
 
Anglais courant : lu, écrit, parlé (présentations orales en anglais)

Durée : 6 mois (dès mars 2023)
Lieu: Le poste sera basé sur l’île de Nantes, à Nantes (44)
Tuteur de stage: Jean-Marc Brun
Merci de postuler avec une lettre de motivation.

Références bibliographiques (non exhaustif)
- [1] https://megagonlabs.medium.com/learning-to-detect-semantic-types-from-large-table-corpora-fe22fcd97060
- [2] https://arxiv.org/abs/1911.06311   : Sato: Contextual Semantic Type Detection in Tables
- [3] https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2352711019302626 : SeMi: A SEmantic Modeling machIne to build Knowledge Graphs with graph neural networks
- [4] https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.12871 : DCoM: A Deep Column Mapper for Semantic Data Type Detection
- [5] https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.00781 : Learning Semantic Annotations for Tabular Data
- [6] https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3511808.3557184 : PLASMA: Platform for Auxiliary Semantic Modeling Approaches

Personal Identifiable Information, Semantic Type, Machine Learning, Topic Modeling, Classification, Automatic column detection

#LI-CL1
#LI-REMOTE


AND NOW, A LITTLE ABOUT US:

Talend has received some pretty impressive accolades along the way:

- 7,250+ global customers rely on Talend for their data health
- Named a Leader for Data Integration Tools by Gartner (for the 7th year in a row)
- Named a Leader for Data Quality Solutions by Gartner (for the 5th year in a row)
- Named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Enterprise Data Fabric (for the 2nd time in a row)
- Top 100 best Leadership teams, compensation and benefits 2022 by Comparably.com
- Ranked in the DBTA “100 Companies that Matter Most in Data”
 
We are passionate about helping companies become more data driven; and, if we can be honest, we are all geeks at heart who pride ourselves on the vibrant company culture that we have built.
 


As a global employer, Talend believes our success depends on diversity, inclusion and mutual respect among our team members. We want to look like our customers, and we recruit, develop and retain the most hardworking people from a diverse candidate pool. We are committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of business need, merit, capability and equality of opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us via email to request an accommodation at accommodation@talend.com. We appreciate your interest in Talend.

By submitting your application, you confirm you have read and acknowledge Talend’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. We may use automated decision making of your responses during our evaluation of your job application, for instance, to determine if your residence or proficiency fits the requirements for the job opportunity. You can exercise your privacy rights, including your right to object to automated decision making (if applicable), by filling out this privacy form or contacting privacy@talend.com.

Notice to Recruiters and Staffing Agencies
Talend does not accept any unsolicited applications from third parties – for our current agency policy please check here

descriptionPlain:
WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
 
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
 
We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for a  Senior Back-End developer to the development team of the Talend Data Governance Platform team. This team provides all necessary services to support Talend's products requirements. All these services must comply with the expected 99.9% SLA requirement.

The ideal candidate should be well-versed with the entire software development lifecycle from development to production monitoring.  We are looking for skilled engineer comfortable with Java, Scala, Docker & Kubernetes but also experienced in debugging distributed systems. Apart from possessing strong technical skills, the candidate should show a strong bias for action. He should be open-minded and comfortable with the motto: "You design it, you build it, you operate it". 

Key responsibilities 

· Identify tactical and long-terms product improvements (could be code, script or documentation related)
 · Collaborating with other team members in investigating and resolving technical or performance issues and performing root cause analysis 
· Lead and contribute to the implementation of improvements (could be code, scripts, configuration) 
·  Production support (working hours) 
·  Evangelization of dev and QA team about production support best practices 
·  Maintaining technical documentation 

Skills and experience 

·  BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. 
·  At least around 2 years of practical experience in Java software development 
·  Knowledge In-depth knowledge and practical experience in Linux and Docker 
·  Ability to communicate smoothly, effectively and clearly in English, both verbally and in writing. 
·  First experience with a public cloud platform such as Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure 
·  Self learner, active technology watch 

Nice to have 

·  Experience with PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Prometheus 
·  Experience in working within a distributed & international agile team environment 
·  Good understanding and hands-on experience with Kubernetes
